# pyp5js gameboards
## A [repo](https://github.com/villares/pyp5js-gameboards) with examples for using pyp5js to make simple games

[pyp5js](https://berinhard.github.io) is a wonderful project that combines Python in your browser (with pyodide) and the drawing infrastructure of [p5js.org](https://p5js.org), you chan check the [online demo editor here](https://abav.lugaralgum.com/pyp5js/pyodide/). The drawing function names and global variable names are mostly those of *p5js*, but `function setup(){}` & `function draw(){}` become `def setup():` & `def draw():`, because, well, we love Python!

This repository collects code examples for using *pyp5js* to teach and to play simple board games. If you make one, feel free to make a Pull Request. I ask everyone to abstain from submiting materials unsuitable for children, as we'd like this repository to be used for teaching.

## A chess set with emojis

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3694604/200909468-f9b2fe10-0ac6-4e23-89f6-2f84d8ef4443.png)

- [editor + code PT names/comments](https://berinhard.github.io/pyp5js/pyodide/?%3D%3D)

- [sketch-only page](https://abav.lugaralgum.com/pyp5js/sketch-only/?%3D%3D)

## A multipurpose demo example

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3694604/200914670-4a392b67-6cbd-4f2a-bde2-1130699f7f3e.png)

```python
...
grid = True    # draw a grid
w = 100        # grid cell width 
cols = 8       # number grid of collumns
rows = 8       # number grid of rows
chess = False  # True makes grid cells alternate black and white

img_url = 'https://i.ibb.co/RCPfVkc/199727104-be1a69fa-1e44-47b2-8778-56f7f257c96b.png'
background_image = False  # True will load the image from the URL above

dice = None   # not visible
n_dice = 10   # this is a d10, d6 are special!
...
    # Describe pieces here!
    pieces = [
      # [symbol, color, col, row, degrees_rotation],
        ['‚ñ≤', a_blue, 0, 1, 90], 
        ['üêä', 0, 0, 0, 0], 
        ['‚ôú', a_red, 1, 0, 0], 
        ['‚óº', a_green, 1, 1,0], 
    ]
...
```

- [editor + code EN names/comments](https://abav.lugaralgum.com/pyp5js/pyodide/?%3D) 

- To create a "sketch-only" link, replace `berinhard.github.io/pyp5js/pyodide` with `abav.lugaralgum.com/pyp5js/sketch-only` in the url!
